Åšramaá¹‡a Minister, RichikÅ, and others respectfully translated by imperial decree, Chapter on the Pure Abodes Heaven's Recitation of Verses in Praise of the Buddha, Part 2 At that time, the Son of Heaven who Praises Goodness spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha transcends the ocean of the three existences, able to transform those who are difficult to transform,
Therefore, in the world, he is called fearless.
At that time, the Son of Heaven who Reaches the Truth spoke a verse, saying:
Accomplishing omniscience, eliminating all afflictions and karma,
Causing them to be exhausted without remainder, this is called great tranquility.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of the Dharma Banner spoke a verse, saying:
Erecting the lofty and supreme Dharma banner, destroying the firm and solid arrogance,
With immeasurable courageous strength, showing sentient beings the right path.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of the Dharma Ocean spoke a verse, saying:
The Sage speaks of all dharmas, as a great treasury of the Dharma,
Guiding and leading those who are confused, enabling them to reach a place of peace and security.
At that time, the celestial son Dharma Robe spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's disciples abide in the great Dharma, their minds never content,
Enduring peacefully and free from all fears, thus they are able to roar like lions.
At that time, the celestial son Seeking the Meaning of the Dharma spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's disciples skillfully understand and should diligently seek the true Dharma,
Having heard it, they practice as instructed and will quickly attain the path of enlightenment.
At that time, the celestial son Yearning for the Dharma spoke a verse, saying:ğŸ”½Immeasurable hundreds of thousands, millions,
Billions of sentient beings,
Yearning to hear the Buddha's voice, their resolve firm, always diligently progressing.
At that time, the celestial son Courageous Dharma spoke a verse, saying:
Endowed with vast eloquence, destroying all heterodox theories,
Delighting in cultivating supreme practices, they attain the highest enlightenment.
At that time, the celestial son DharmÄdhará¹£a spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha speaks the foremost Dharma, which is extremely profound and difficult to understand.
He seals the supreme truth as empty, enabling one to attain the path of tranquility.
At that time, the celestial son RatiÅ›Å«ra spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's disciples skillfully practice giving, abandoning their own lives,
And for this reason, they attain perfect supreme enlightenment.
At that time, the celestial son VÄ«tarÄga-prajÃ±Ä spoke a verse, saying:
Firmly upholding pure precepts, their minds are fearless.
Hearing the sound of the Buddha's true Dharma, they accept it on the crown of their heads without forgetting.
At that time, the celestial son AvinirbhÄga spoke a verse, saying:
The Dharma King, the Sage, skillfully expounds all dharmas,
Not seeking the fruits of the two vehicles, diligently cultivating the unsurpassed path.
At that time, the Son of Heaven Close-to-Abiding spoke a verse, saying:
The hero, the honored one of the two-legged beings, appears for the sake of sentient beings,
Discerning and expounding the three vehicles, ultimately only the Buddha's wisdom.
At that time, the Son of Heaven Accomplishing Eloquence spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's name pervades the ten directions, his eloquence is unlimited and unobstructed,
All with a pure mind, joyfully following along with what is expounded.
At that time, the Son of Heaven Accomplishing Eloquence Each spoke a verse, saying:
If a person lacks eloquence, he seeks a vow from the Buddha,
Expounding the Dharma to remove all fears, those who hear do not slander.
At that time, the Son of Heaven Constant Joy spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's disciples abide in the power of patience, rebuking and slandering without anger,
Aspiring to great enlightenment, always joyful without cowardice.
At that time, the Son of Heaven Free from the Two Vehicles spoke a verse, saying:
As the eldest son of the TathÄgata, I do not delight in the inferior vehicle.
If I hear the Buddha's voice, I will only pursue the unsurpassed path.
At that time, the god-son Invincible spoke a verse, saying:
Fearlessly and with great vigor, I do not fear the afflictions.
Abandoning the Pratyekabuddha and ÅšrÄvaka vehicles, I vow to seek the unsurpassed wisdom.
At that time, the god-son Continuously Cultivating Good Dharmas spoke a verse, saying:
Delighting in cultivating the pure dharmas, without interruption,
The Sage, the Great Guide, knows their basis.
At that time, the god-son Skillfully Expounding the Dharma spoke a verse, saying:
Embracing the true Dharma, approved by the TathÄgata,
Abiding in firm vigor, like the full moon without waning.
At that time, the god-son Good Dharma Nature spoke a verse, saying:
The intrinsic nature of dharmas is pure and white, yet it is covered by adventitious dust.
All arise from defiled mind, which the TathÄgata is able to directly realize.
At that time the Son of Heaven Who Attains Right Principle spoke a verse, saying:
The nature of dharmas is originally undefiled; black and white do not coexist.
This accords with right principle, and is what the TathÄgata teaches.
At that time the Son of Heaven Who Discriminates Between Good and Evil spoke a verse, saying:
All unwholesome dharmas can be destroyed by the power of wholesome dharmas.
If unwholesome dharmas increase, they will harm wholesome deeds.
At that time the Son of Heaven Who Enters Right Understanding spoke a verse, saying:
Due to defiled conduct, wholesome dharmas do not increase,
and will definitely become conditions for harm - this is what the TathÄgata teaches.
At that time the Son of Heaven Who Seeks Liberation spoke a verse, saying:
The power of defilements is strong, and the mind does not aspire for liberation.
It obscures all-knowledge, in this skillful discernment.
At that time, the Heavenly Son Bright Mind spoke a verse, saying:
If the mind is free from desires, evil karma will not arise again.
The TathÄgata is able to testify to this and expounds it for the sake of sentient beings.
At that time, the Heavenly Son Seeing Afflictions spoke a verse, saying:
If one does not understand the true Dharma and does not know defiled conduct,
One will always go against the Buddha's words and be further away from the sage's path.
At that time, the Heavenly Son Seeing Sinful Conduct spoke a verse, saying:
If one does not create evil, wholesome karma will increase.
Therefore, the wise person delights in liberation and peace.
At that time, the Heavenly Son Power of Faith spoke a verse, saying:
Departing from the conduct of greed, anger, and delusion, one can transcend the evil paths.
The TathÄgata appears in the world and always teaches like this.
At that time, the Heavenly Son Knowing Good and Evil spoke a verse, saying:
If one is unable to discriminate between defiled and pure dharmas,
The Buddha says such a person is the most foolish.
At that time, the god of the stage of liberation spoke a verse, saying:
Following the Buddha's teachings, abandoning all that is unwholesome,
This person will definitely attain accomplishment in the noble path.
At that time, the god of the stage of manifest liberation spoke a verse, saying:
If one abandons all evil dharmas, wholesome actions will manifest.
Diligent and unremitting in practice, Mara the Evil One will find no opportunity.
At that time, the god of the stage of conforming to right principle spoke a verse, saying:
The Dharma taught by the Buddhas benefits and delights all beings,
Causing them to stay far away from inappropriate situations, not following their exhortations.
At that time, the god of auspicious fearlessness spoke a verse, saying:
The contemplation of impurity treats greed, being the corresponding right practice,
When that greed is eliminated, one should cause the hindrances to turn far away.
At that time, the celestial son Advancing to Supreme Wisdom spoke a verse, saying:
The contemplation of loving-kindness treats anger, and that anger attains liberation.
Even if one encounters deep enmity, one does not give rise to the slightest fear.
At that time, the celestial son Pure Eyes spoke a verse, saying:
Pure wisdom eliminates deluded thoughts, which are the dharmas to be countered.
That delusion has already been eliminated, and one does not follow the instructions of others.
At that time, the celestial son Destroying Doubts spoke a verse, saying:
Abiding in correct mindfulness and contemplation, one can leave behind all doubts.
Even if one encounters heretical teachers and friends, one skillfully subdues them in accordance with the Dharma.
At that time, the celestial son Reaching Signlessness spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata speaks of the Dharma of emptiness, abiding well in emptiness.
Having reached the correct principle, this is not realized through others.
At that time, the celestial son Removing Arrogance spoke a verse, saying:
Understanding one's own and others' arrogance, what is gained by being haughty?
In accord with right practice, all should be eliminated and severed.
At that time, the celestial son Tranquil Mind spoke a verse, saying:
Permanently severing all doubts and suspicions, the profound mind is always tranquil.
Afflictions do not arise again, and one peacefully attains liberation.
At that time, the celestial son Contemplative Illumination spoke a verse, saying:
Understanding the path and what is not the path, relying on purity to be free from defilements,
In accord with the words of the buddhas, one removes fear and attains liberation.
At that time, the celestial son Understanding Conventionalities spoke a verse, saying:
Conventionalities are only provisional names, able to give rise to the path of remedies;
One should know that the World-Honored One is also provisionally established with a name.
At that time, the celestial son Physical Postures spoke a verse, saying:
Using wisdom as the guide, bodily actions follow the practice of the Dharma,
Benefiting and delighting all sentient beings, one attains omniscience.
At that time, the god Son of Pure Bodily Actions spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's bodily actions are pure, his deeds are without error,
He has compassion for all beings, I now take refuge and pay homage.
At that time, the god Son of Determined Bodily Actions spoke a verse, saying:
Bodily actions are well-determined, skillful means benefit all beings,
I pay homage with faith to the Tamer, the Illuminator of the World.
At that time, the god Son of Good Observation of the Body spoke a verse, saying:
Well observing bodily actions, endowed with pure and excellent characteristics,
Being the unsurpassed hero, able to bestow happiness upon all.
At that time, the god Son of Accomplished Verbal Actions spoke a verse, saying:
Far removed from those evil words, endowed with beautiful and wonderful virtues,
Abiding in right mindfulness and contemplation, this is what the TathÄgata teaches.
At that time, the god-son Yingbian spoke in verse:
The TathÄgata's Brahma-like voice is respected by the world.
He skillfully observes the timing for each, and does not speak of what is not beneficial.
At that time, the god-son Chengyili spoke in verse:
Far from what is not beneficial, he is endowed with blissful peace.
He does not destroy the fruits of retribution, this is what the former Buddhas taught.
At that time, the god-son Buhuixiangwei spoke in verse:
He never engages in wrong livelihood, seeking profit through false speech.
Therefore, the Buddha's great fame cannot be destroyed by the world.
At that time, the god-son Shiyu spoke in verse:
When the Buddha appears in the world, what he says is all true.
Therefore, the gods and humans all delight in hearing the wonderful Dharma.
At that time, the celestial son Realizing Reality spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha, by means of true speech, has attained supreme perfect enlightenment,
Realizing the arising of all dharmas, he is called the one with right and universal knowledge.
At that time, the celestial son Transcending Arising spoke a verse, saying:
If there are conditioned dharmas, and the true nature of all dharmas,
The king among the teachings of the Sage, knows and sees them in accordance with principle.
At that time, the celestial son Determined Conduct spoke a verse, saying:
Regarding what is done by oneself or others, the actions of body, speech, and mind,
The Buddha, with pure wisdom, is able to distinguish and explain them all.
At that time, the celestial son Concentrated Intention spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha, with a pure mind, looks upon sentient beings six times,
Taking refuge in the World-Honored One, whose great compassion is unequaled.
At that time, the celestial son Skillful Observation spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata's actions are all perfect, his deportment is without deficiency,
Compassion and wisdom are always in accord, he has pity for the three realms of existence.
At that time, the celestial son Mind of Awareness spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's mind is the place of objects, his body and speech are all pliant,
In the midst of the great assembly, he has never made a mistake.
At that time, the celestial son Clearly Understanding Intention spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha takes the mind as the ground, with great compassion he observes sentient beings,
Knowing the nature of dharmas is empty, he uses skillful means to cause them to awaken.
At that time, the celestial son Skillful in the Past spoke a verse, saying:
If a person in the past cultivated various practices,
Giving, morality, patience, vigor, and meditation, the TathÄgata is fully aware of them all.
At that time, the celestial son Observing the Past spoke a verse, saying:
Having planted various roots of virtue in the past, he served many koá¹­is of Buddhas,
Now fulfilling that ancient aspiration, he has attained the fruit of enlightenment.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Perfect and Corresponding Practices spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha, for innumerable eons, cultivated supreme practices everywhere,
Always corresponding with right mindfulness, not abandoning bodhi.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Observing Past Practices spoke a verse, saying:
Intimately attending to the tathÄgatas, cultivating good inquiry,
Delighting in abiding in samÄdhi, giving rise to various dharmas.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Corresponding with Past Practices spoke a verse, saying:
In the past, in the presence of the buddhas, inquiring and practicing according to the teachings,
In the gateway of samÄdhi, observing without weariness.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Knowing Past Abodes spoke a verse, saying:
Saá¹ƒsÄra has many faults, what should be done and what should not be done,
The TathÄgata, having understood this, expounds the Dharma of liberation.
At that time, the god Son of Foreseeing Past Actions spoke a verse, saying:
In the past, we together created various evils, tainted and defiled, similar in karma,
Sometimes we devoured each other, sometimes we played with each other.
At that time, the god Son of Understanding Past Limits spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata appears in the world, with the power of concentration and wisdom,
Able to know the past world, with no obstruction in the destinies.
At that time, the god Son of Knowing Future Limits spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha knows the future world, with unobstructed wisdom,
From here passing away and being born there, the retribution of karma is also like this.
At that time, the god Son of Knowing the Realm of Future Limits spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata knows the future limits, with the power of wisdom having no obstruction,
The practices carried out by sentient beings, according to karma they receive their retribution.
At that time, the god Son of Leaving Saá¹ƒsÄra spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata is greatly courageous and accomplished the unsurpassed wisdom,
Not attached to the three existences, abiding in the supreme realm.
At that time, the celestial son Understanding Conventionality spoke a verse, saying:
The various thoughts that beings return to,
Are only provisional names, as taught by the TathÄgata.
At that time, the celestial son Observing the Present spoke a verse, saying:
The present courageous and venerable one, whose wisdom power is indestructible,
In buddha-lands as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, discriminates without obstruction.
At that time, the celestial son Abiding in Fearlessness spoke a verse, saying:
The Dharma king among the holy lords illuminates the three times equally,
All dharmas are without self-nature, which the foolish cannot understand.
At that time, the celestial son Wisdom Without Attachment spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata is well-tamed, not abiding in the three times,
Because dharmas are devoid of intrinsic nature, nothing can be attained.
At that time, the celestial son of the wisdom of the three times spoke a verse, saying:
Understanding the past and future to be without substance, the aggregates arise and suddenly return to cessation.
Such is the characteristic of samsara, as spoken by the Sage.
At that time, the celestial son of unattached mind spoke a verse, saying:
All dharmas are illusory transformations, like mirages and echoes in a valley.
Sentient beings and the world have an intrinsic nature that is not real.
At that time, the celestial son of the joy of the three times spoke a verse, saying:
The TathÄgata's wisdom is unequaled, able to understand the three times.
The faculties are empty of intrinsic nature, all are like illusions.
At that time, the celestial son of the desire for practice spoke a verse, saying:
In the middle of the night, the TathÄgata manifested the attainment of perfect enlightenment.
Giving rise to diligent effort and desire, there has never been any regression.
At that time, the god Son of Elation spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha is the light of the world, his diligence is without decrease,
Because of his great courage and strength, he surpasses and attains perfect enlightenment.
At that time, the god Son of Transcending Desires spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha appears in the world, with utmost courageous diligence,
Able to transcend the mud of desires, like a lotus untainted by water.
At that time, the god Son of Delight in Liberation spoke a verse, saying:
The Tathagata appears in the world, teaching the equality of the dharma realm,
There is only one, without a second appearance, therefore I praise and pay homage.
At that time, the god Son of Initiating Diligence spoke a verse, saying:
The Tathagata has great majestic virtue, able to awaken the masses,
Diligent in practice, without laziness, the celestial demons cannot destroy him.
At that time, the god Son of Perfect Mindfulness spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha always gives rise to right mindfulness in all places,
Therefore, after attaining enlightenment, he obtains inexhaustible mindfulness.
At that time, the god Son of Equanimity said in verse:
The TathÄgata is always in samÄdhi, knowing the natures and desires of sentient beings,
According to their practices, he expounds the teachings for them.
At that time, the god Son of Right Wisdom said in verse:
The World-Honored One's great ocean of wisdom has boundless limits,
Even if one were to speak for a hundred thousand eons, one could not exhaust it.
At that time, the god Son of Delight in Liberation said in verse:
The unsurpassed hero delights in the supreme liberation,
Because he realizes liberation, he is not attached to the three non-endurances.
At that time, the god Son of Liberation in Accordance with Understanding said in verse:
The Sage, the Great Honored One, is endowed with the knowledge and vision of liberation,
Liberating innumerable sentient beings, true wisdom never diminishes.

Diligent in cultivation without turning back, he attained great enlightenment.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Profound Practice spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha has long been free from all evils, unlike other sentient beings,
Knowing the nature of dharmas is empty, unobstructed in the three periods of time.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of Vast Wisdom spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha has no doubts in omniscience,
Right mindfulness always manifests, like holding a bowl full of oil.
At that time, the Son of Heaven of No Distraction spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha's mind is always tranquil, never distracted,
The nature of dharmas is originally undefiled, sentient beings cannot understand.
At that time, the god of celestial sons of abiding wisdom spoke a verse, saying:
The unshared dharmas of the TathÄgata are profound and inconceivable,
Never having failed to choose and abandon all sentient beings.
At that time, the god of celestial sons surpassing all existences spoke a verse, saying:
The Buddha is the celestial immortal, unequaled in the three realms,
Fully comprehending all dharmas, his supreme wisdom is unsurpassed.
